entry.title: Carenado Publishes PC-12 Screenshots
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS. Carenado has recently showcased various screenshots of their upcoming visual rendition of the Pilatus PC-12 aircraft for Microsoft Flight Simulator. This comes after a period of tight-lipped silence from the developers. Carenado did express an apologetic state, as they have experienced unexpected delays in the release of this aircraft to the public. They do hope to surpass these setbacks and move forward with the release aircraft. In the screenshots posted to their Facebook page, they showcased working GTNXi by TDS, and the in-house EX600 Suite. With these operational, Carenado hopes to move forward with development and an eventual release. Be sure to follow Threshold for more updates.

entry.title: Thranda Releases Free Expansion Pack for C208 Grand Caravan
entry.summary: Sim: X-Plane. Last week, developer Thranda announced via the X-Plane forum the release of a new expansion pack for its C208 and C208B Grand Caravan. The best part: this pack is completely free and can be downloaded from the X-Plane.org store! The feedback on the forum is very positive. Users seem to be delighted with this free and well-developed initiative. But what exactly does this pack contain? First of all a seaplane version of the Grand Caravan equipped with floats. â For the landplane version, the pack offers tundra tires and mud flaps, enabling operations in rough terrains. The package also offers changes to the interior of the aircraft such as an integrated G1000. The seats will also be removable via presets, allowing the aircraft to serve either as a passenger or cargo plane. These features will be available for both the amphibious and landplane models. Currently, users who already purchased the plane can download the expansion pack together with the new version. Those who are looking to pick up the aircraft can purchase it on the X-Plane.org store for $44.95, â

entry.title: ShortFinal Design Releases KSFO Definitive for XP11
entry.summary: Sim: X-Plane. Known developer for X-Plane 11, ShortFinal Design (aka MisterX6) has released his long-awaited KSFO Definitive Project for X-Plane 11. With many updates from the previous rendition, this visual rendition of San Francisco International impresses one and all, with new techniques used by the developer. MisterX6 released his first and only freeware rendition of KSFO back in 2015, and it underwent updates till he moved to payware projects. Since then, the San Francisco area received no love from developers, till SFD announced he was revisiting the area and had started from scratch on the project. This rendition has a vast inclusion list that has been provided. Starting off, the usage of SAM for jetways and airport operations has been used to add realism and life to the airport. The airport layout shipped is the current layout of KSFO as of 2022. Various animations of airport vehicles, workers, and passengers have also been included. The usage of PBR textures is present throughout the scenery package. For the complete feature list, you can view it on the X-Plane.Org Store This rendition of KSFO is now available on the .Org Store and sells for $26.95. If you are interested in other packages developed by ShortFinal Design, you can view his payware catalog on the .Org Store as well. If you are interested in his freeware catalog, you can have a look over on his forum page.

entry.title: IniBuilds Announces Dallas Love Field for MSFS and Partnership with iBlueYonder
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS. IniBuilds has announced its partnership with iBlueYonderpour to develop its upcoming Dallas Love Field (KDAL) scenery for Microsoft Flight Simulator. After complimenting the CEO of iBlueYonder, Bill Womack, IniBuilds revealed that it has already started development on KDAL. However, neither developers have disclosed any details on either the scenery or the partnership. Though IniBuilds is well known within the community, iBlueYonder may be a less familiar face to some. In reality however, iBlueYonder is very experienced in the creation of sceneries for P3D, X-Plane, FSX, and MSFS. More details on the developers can be found here. But why choose KDAL? Though Lovefield is often overshadowed by Fort Worth, it is located much closer to Dallas city center and serves as a main hub for Southwest Airlines, a well-known low cost airline that operates an all 737 fleet. Southwest, Delta and Alaska also flies a few flights to select destinations per day. â The IniBuilds forum post ends with the announcement of a trailer about this airport that will be available soon. Currently no release date or pricing had been disclosed. Threshold will keep you updated on this front. â

entry.title: PMDG 737-800NG at âTop of descentâ

PMDG, developer of the popular 737 series add-ons for P3D and MSFS, has announced that the next aircraft of their 737 series, the -800, for Microsoft Flight Simulator is at the âtop of descentâ. entry.title: RJ Professional by Just Flight Simulation for MSFS in development
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS. After the great success of the B-146 Professional for x-plane 11, the developers of Just Flight have set themselves a new challenge: As in real life, they want to develop the 146 Professional into the RJ Professional, a new range that will be exclusively available for MSFS. Just Flight are excited to announce that they are working on the RJ professional range which will include 3 variants: The RJ70, the RJ85 and the RJ100. Variants exclusively available for MSFS. â If we look at the historical context of aviation, the RJ range, derived from the 146 range from 1993 onwards (1988 for the RJ100). We can note improvements made from this date, such as the introduction of an EFIS cockpit with digital displays replacing the ADI, HSI and engine instrumentation present on the 146. â This is exactly what Just Flight is putting forward in the development of the RJ Professional, the same changes are being implemented. There have been many other changes between the 146 and the RJ, both in real life and in the simulation world with Just Flight indicating these changes on the aircraft web page. â â â On the 15th of August, Just Flight published development updates with images available of this future product, both cockpit and exterior model images are seen, without telling us much more. They simply inform us that work is still in progress, that pictures are available and that they will keep us informed of future updates. But for the moment, there is no official release date for this aircraft. â â â â

entry.title: InDepthSimulations Piper Comanche 250 development update
entry.summary: Sim: X-Plane. InDepthSimulations have provided fans with an update in the development of their PA-24 Comanche 250 for X-plane 11. Exclusive news to threshold was provided by the lead developer from IDS around the future of the comanche project and whats to be expected!Â The comanche 250 first flew in 1956 and production ceased in 1972 with just under 5,000 of the aircraft rolled off the production line. The comanche is still ever popular to this day and you can find them flying in many countries. Never before in X-plane 11 has the Comanche 250 been developed in such detail and its sure to be an impressive aircraft when it is finished. entry.title: Northern Sky studio release Yakutat Airport
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS. Northern Sky studio have released their all new Yakutat scenery for Microsoft Flight Simulator. Yakutat airport is located in southern Alaska, It is an incredibly important airport for the area. Alaska airlines operate regular flights in and out of the field in both passenger and cargo Boeing 737-700 aircraft. The location of the field is ideal for exploring Alaska or for short passenger flight operations to areas such as Juneau or Cordova. Yakutat also played a vital role in World War 2 as a landing field for aircraft between Washington State and Elmendorf Air Force Base according to ORBX. â â A popular general aviation airport, the only airliner traffic seen regularly at Yakutat are Alaska Airlines 737-700's.
